title: AirAsia Group shares fall 4 percent after India files case against airline and CEO
text:
May 30, 2018 / 1:50 AM / Updated 7 minutes ago AirAsia Group shares fall 4 percent after India files case against airline and CEO Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
KUALA LUMPUR (Reuters) - Shares of AirAsia Group Bhd ( AIRA.KL ) fell as much as 4.2 percent early on Wednesday after India federal police filed a case against the airline and its CEO Tony Fernandes. FILE PHOTO: AirAsia planes sit on the tarmac at Kuala Lumpur International Airport, Malaysia August 28, 2016. REUTERS/Edgar Su/File Photo
Indian police said on Tuesday they have filed a case the airline, Fernandes and its domestic entity AirAsia India, over allegations of corruption and breaking rules in obtaining a flying licence.
Malaysiaâ€™s wider market was down 1.9 percent. Reporting by Rozanna Latiff and Liz Lee; Editing by Edwina Gibbs
